content:
Embarking on a journey through the Dark Souls series is a noble pursuit! While there isn't a strictly "recommended" order to play the games in, there are a few ways to approach the series to get the most out of your experience.

Here are a few options:

1. **Chronological order**: If you want to follow the lore and storyline in a linear fashion, you can play the games in this order:
	* Demon's Souls (2009) - This is a spiritual predecessor to the Dark Souls series, but it's set in a different world and has its own unique story.
	* Dark Souls (2011)
	* Dark Souls II (2014)
	* Dark Souls III (2016)
	* Dark Souls Remastered (2018) - This is a remastered version of the original Dark Souls, with improved graphics and performance.
2. **Release order**: If you want to experience the series in the order that the games were released, you can play them in this order:
	* Demon's Souls (2009)
	* Dark Souls (2011)
	* Dark Souls II (2014)
	* Dark Souls III (2016)
	* Dark Souls Remastered (2018)
3. **Thematic order**: If you want to group the games by their themes and tone, you can play them in this order:
	* Demon's Souls (2009) - This game has a more atmospheric, horror-focused tone.
	* Dark Souls (2011) - This game sets the tone for the rest of the series, with its dark fantasy world and challenging gameplay.
	* Dark Souls II (2014) - This game is often considered the most experimental in the series, with a greater emphasis on exploration and player choice.
	* Dark Souls III (2016) - This game is a culmination of the series, with a more refined gameplay experience and a focus on wrapping up the story.
	* Dark Souls Remastered (2018) - This game is a refinement of the original Dark Souls, with improved graphics and performance.

Ultimately, the order you choose will depend on your personal preferences and how you want to experience the series. If you're new to the series, I'd recommend starting with the original Dark Souls or Dark Souls Remastered to get a feel for the gameplay and world.

Remember, the Dark Souls series is known for its challenging gameplay and deep lore, so be prepared to die a lot and take your time to soak in the atmosphere and story!
